title: Cryptomultiplier
author: Cryptomultiplier
content: I had to ask this, although I know someone here may have reasoned in line with this, having read something similar as a post thread or comments in any section here.° Can an online business besides just a gambling platform, which accepts Bitcoin as payments or for payouts, run a signature campaign on this Bitcoin talk forum, or is the term 'signature campaign' strictly attributed to gambling platforms?° Is there another kind of forum for online businesses that accepts Bitcoin as payment, which is similar in concept like this forum? If no, is there any other discovery you have had that's close in initiative to an active community as this, which aims to help advertise, market, educate, inform and encourage adopting payments in BTC and crypto currency in general? Your thoughts and opinions are welcomed!

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Don’t mixers and exchanges run signature campaign here? The forum signature space is not limited to just gambling, mixers or exchanges alone but the reason why you see those type of services here is because of what the forum is related to and the type of users present here. It will not be wise for a service that has nothing to do with crypto or that has nothing to do with the things that bitcointalkers are interested in to come to the forum and start advertising their service by running a signature campaign, they’ll only just be wasting whatever money they’ll be paying.The main aim of running an ads is to target people that will be interested in your service if you’re aware that the people present in a community will never patronize you no matter how you approach them because they have no need for your service then you’ll have to look for those in need of it, and that’s why you majorly see crypto related service here. Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 18, 2023, 07:19:28 PM° Is there another kind of forum for online businesses that accepts Bitcoin as payment, which is similar in concept like this forum? If no, is there any other discovery you have had that's close in initiative to an active community as this, which aims to help advertise, market, educate, inform and encourage adopting payments in BTC and crypto currency in general? I believe altcointalk still run signature campaigns and bounties but it’s not as active as Bitcointalk, and most of the users there have migrated to bitcoin while the ones left are majorly those that got banned from Bitcointalk and now engaged in bounties over there.

comments.author: Orpichukwu
comments.body: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5423833.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5464287.0https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5457754.0Above are three different services that are not casinos that have signature campaigns, and there are also crypto-related platforms that accept crypto currency for both deposit and withdrawal. Signature is not just for casinos alone; even as mixer and casino sijgnature are the ones topping the chart here, there are other things that if they need to run a signature campaign, they are allowed to do that, provided that there is nothing violating the forum rules that could be found on their signature code. You are all good.

comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 18, 2023, 07:19:28 PM° Can an online business besides just a gambling platform, which accepts Bitcoin as payments or for payouts, run a signature campaign on this Bitcoin talk forum, or is the term 'signature campaign' strictly attributed to gambling platforms?If your business or company have connections with bitcoins in form of services, and you are interested in promoting it in a place that has a good number of people with interest in bitcoins, this forum is top on that list. If you have the funds to run a signature campaign to promote your company service, that is a form of marketing project for it, and you can do it in this forum.So far, we have had casinos, mixers, exchanges, IP Stresser / DDoS tool companies like "[banned site]" run campaigns on the forum, we will see more.

Still, most of the signature campaigns are run by gambling sites because they know that this community is the best place for promotion of their platforms and launching of a signature campaign is the best way to get exposure from all the users of the forum. There are other businesses like mixers, exchanges, and p2p clients that are running their signature campaigns on this forum sucessfully.Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 18, 2023, 07:19:28 PM° Is there another kind of forum for online businesses that accepts Bitcoin as payment, which is similar in concept like this forum? This is the only forum where we have an active community of users who are interested in Bitcoin and who contribute their valuable opinions, ideas, and information about Bitcoin on this forum.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Quote from: Cryptomultiplier on September 18, 2023, 08:42:32 PMYou read my conscience on this I must say...hehehe. I no longer understand your point. Are you looking for other forums that pay people for renting their signatures, or talking about other advertising services on the forum that are not related to gambling?All advertising share a simple principle, which is that there is an influential person who has an audience base such that they believe that what he is advertising is something useful, whether that influence is by preparing videos, or by writing high-quality posts. From here we find that advertising campaigns are looking for those people, and almost all of us used or is using cryptocurrencies, so it is a suitable place for anyone who wants to manage a crypto advertising campaign, although the advertising here are not limited to signature campaigns.

As others has responded, if you visit the service board you'll see different campaign so I hope that answer your question. Just for a side note, signature isn't moderated by the forum therefore all project are welcomed on the forum except those NSFW. Also when they don't get the inflow of advertisers as they thought they'll get when they launched their platform, it fails. One reason Bitcointalk has survive this long isn't because they're paying their users but because of the value of the platforms. People join the forum to seek for knowledge and there are constant improvement on the forum to keep the quality and activities on a constructive standard. When the forum notice the increase in spamming and quality was reducing, the merit system was introduced but those other platforms only care about activities and not quality that's why they're failing.
